 13994                                  
 13995                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13996                                  ;
 13997                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13998                                  ;
 13999                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14000                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14001                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14002                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14003                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14004                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14005                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14006                                  ;
 14007                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14008                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14009                                  ;
 14010                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14011                                  
 14012                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14013                                  HMAPtr:
 14014 00001411 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14015                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14016 00001416 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14017                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14018 0000141A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14019 0000141D 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14020 0000141F 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14021                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14022 00001424 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14023 00001426 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14024                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14025 0000142A 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14026                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14027                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14028 0000142E C3                      		retn
 14029                                  
 14030                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14031                                  
 14032                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14033                                  
 14034                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14035                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14036                                  
 14037                                  move_sector:
 14038                                  
 14039                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14040                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14041                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14042                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14043                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14044                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14045                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14046                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14047                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14048                                  ;
 14049                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14050                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14051                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14052                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14053                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14054                                  
 14055 0000142F FC                      		cld
 14056 00001430 51                      		push	cx
 14057 00001431 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14058 00001434 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14059 00001438 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14060 0000143A 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14061 0000143E 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14062 00001440 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14063 00001442 59                      		pop	cx
 14064 00001443 C3                      		retn
 14065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14066                                  
 14067                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14068 00001444 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14069 00001446 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14070 00001448 59                      		pop	cx
 14071 00001449 C3                      		retn
 14072                                  
 14073                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14074                                  
 14075                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14076                                  
 14077                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14078                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14079                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14080                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14081                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14082                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14083                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14084                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14085                                  ;
 14086                                  ; input conditions:
 14087                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14088                                  ;
 14089                                  ; output:
 14090                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14091                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14092                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14093                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14094                                  
 14095                                  check_wrap:	
 14096 0000144A 50                      		push	ax
 14097 0000144B 53                      		push	bx
 14098 0000144C 06                      		push	es
 14099 0000144D 57                      		push	di
 14100 0000144E E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14101 00001451 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14102                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14103 00001453 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14104                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14105 00001458 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14106 0000145A 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14107 0000145E 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14108 00001460 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14109 00001463 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14110 00001465 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14111 00001467 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14112                                  
 14113                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14114                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14115                                  
 14116 00001469 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14117 0000146B 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14118                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14119 0000146D 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14120 0000146E 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14121                                  					; if on	boundary
 14122                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14123                                  not_on_bound:
 14124 00001470 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14125 00001473 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14126 00001475 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14127 00001477 40                      		inc	ax
 14128 00001478 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14129 0000147A 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14130                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14131 0000147D 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14132 00001481 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14133                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14134                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14135 00001483 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14136 00001485 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14137 00001486 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14138                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14139 00001488 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14140                                  
 14141                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14142                                  
 14143 0000148A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14144 0000148C 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14145 0000148E 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14146                                  
 14147                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14148                                  
 14149 00001490 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14150 00001492 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14151 00001494 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14152                                  no_head_bound:				
 14153 00001495 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14154 00001497 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14155 00001498 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14156 0000149A 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14157 0000149C 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14158 0000149E 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14159 000014A1 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14160 000014A3 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14161 000014A5 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14162 000014A7 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14163 000014A9 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14164 000014AB D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14165 000014AD 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14166 000014AF 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14167                                  no_wrap:				
 14168 000014B1 F8                      		clc
 14169 000014B2 5F                      		pop	di
 14170 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 14171 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14172 000014B5 58                      		pop	ax
 14173 000014B6 C3                      		retn
 14174                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14175                                  
 14176                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14177 000014B7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14178 000014B9 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14179 000014BB EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14180                                  
 14181                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14182                                  
 14183                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14184                                  
 14185                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14186                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14187                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14188                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14189                                  ;
 14190                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14191                                  
 14192                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14193                                  find_bds:	
 14194 000014BD C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14195                                  fbds_1:					
 14196 000014C1 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14197 000014C5 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14198 000014C7 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14199                                  					; go to next bds
 14200 000014CA 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14201 000014CD 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14202 000014CF F9                      		stc
 14203                                  fdbs_2:					
 14204 000014D0 C3                      		retn
 14205                                  
 14206                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14207                                  
 14208                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14209                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14210                                  doint:
 14211                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14212 000014D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14213                                  					; get physical drive number
 14214                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14215                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14216                                  		
 14217 000014D4 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14218 000014D6 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14219 000014D8 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14220                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14221 000014DA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14222                                  					; get request code
 14223                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14224 000014DD FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14225                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14226 000014E0 9D                      		popf
 14227                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14228                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14229 000014E1 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14230                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14231                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14232 000014E6 9C                      		pushf
 14233                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14234 000014E7 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14235                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14236                                  dointdone:				
 14237 000014EA C3                      		retn
 14238                                  
 14239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14240                                  
 14241                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14242                                  
 14243                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14244                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14245                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14246                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14247                                  ;
 14248                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14249                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14250                                  ;
 14251                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14252                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14253                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14254                                  
 14255                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14256                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14257                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14258                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14259                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14260                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14261                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14262                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14263                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14264                                  ;end struc
 14265                                  
 14266                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14267                                  
 14268                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14269                                  ;	ah = function
 14270                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14271                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14272                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14273                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14274                                  ;   output conditions:
 14275                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14276                                  
 14277                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14278                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14279                                  ;
 14280                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14281                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14282                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14283                                  
 14284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14287                                  
 14288 000014EB 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14289                                  
 14290                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14291                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14292                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14293                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14294                                  
 14295                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14296                                  
 14297                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14298                                  
 14299                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14300                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14301                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14302                                  
 14303                                  format_special_stuff:
 14304 000014EF 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14305 000014F4 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14306 000014F6 53                      		push	bx
 14307 000014F7 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14308 000014FA E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14309 000014FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14310 000014FE EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14312                                  
 14313                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14314                                  
 14315                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14316                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14317                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14318                                  
 14319                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14320                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14321 00001500 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14322 00001502 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14323 00001504 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14324 00001505 51                      		push	cx
 14325 00001506 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14326 00001508 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14327 0000150A D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14328 0000150C 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14329 00001510 59                      		pop	cx
 14330 00001511 58                      		pop	ax
 14331 00001512 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14332                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14333 00001514 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14334 00001515 06                      		push	es
 14335                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14336 00001516 2EC41E[EB14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14337                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14338                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14339 0000151B 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14340 0000151D 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14341 00001520 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14342                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14343                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14344 00001524 07                      		pop	es
 14345 00001525 5B                      		pop	bx
 14346 00001526 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14347                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14348                                  
 14349                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14350                                  
 14351                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14352                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14353                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14354                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14355                                  
 14356                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14357 00001528 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14358                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14359 0000152D 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14360 0000152F 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14361                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14362 00001534 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14363                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14364 00001536 50                      		push	ax
 14365 00001537 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14366                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14367                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14368 00001539 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14369                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14370                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14371 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 14372 0000153F EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14373                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14374                                  
 14375                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14376                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14377                                  
 14378                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14379                                  
 14380                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14381                                  
 14382                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14383                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14384                                  
 14385                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14386 00001541 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14387                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14388                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14389 00001542 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14390                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14391                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14392                                  
 14393                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14394                                  
 14395 00001547 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14396 0000154A 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14397 0000154D 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14398                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14399                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14400 0000154F 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14401 00001554 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14402                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14403                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14404                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14405 00001556 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14406                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14407                                  		
 14408 0000155B 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14409                                  		
 14410 0000155C 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14411                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14412 00001561 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14413                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14414                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14415 00001563 9D                      		popf
 14416 00001564 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14417                                  ret_from_i13:
 14418 00001566 1F                      		pop	ds
 14419 00001567 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14421                                  
 14422                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14423                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14424                                  ; a changeline error.
 14425                                  
 14426                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14427 0000156A 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14428                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14429 0000156C 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14430 0000156F 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14431 00001571 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14432 00001573 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14433 00001575 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14434 0000157A 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14435                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14436                                  					; never	would
 14437 0000157C 53                      		push	bx
 14438 0000157D BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14439 00001580 E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14440 00001583 5B                      		pop	bx
 14441                                  int13b:
 14442 00001584 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14443 00001585 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14444                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14445                                  
 14446                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14447                                  
 14448                                  goterr13:
 14449 00001587 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14450 0000158A 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14451                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 14452 0000158C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14453 0000158F 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14454 00001591 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14455 00001596 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14456                                  
 14457 00001598 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14458                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14459                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14460                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14461 0000159D 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14462                                  
 14463 0000159F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14464                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14465                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14466 000015A1 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14467                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14468                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14469 000015A6 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14470 000015A9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14471 000015AB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14472 000015AD 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14473 000015AF 53                      		push	bx
 14474 000015B0 51                      		push	cx
 14475 000015B1 52                      		push	dx
 14476 000015B2 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14477                                  loop_ecc:
 14478 000015B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14479                                  
 14480                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14481                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14482                                  ;
 14483                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14484                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14485                                  ; track.
 14486                                  ;
 14487                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14488                                  ; this request.
 14489                                  ;
 14490                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14491                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14492                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14493                                  ;
 14494 000015B8 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14495                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14496                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14497 000015BB 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14498                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14499 000015C0 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14500 000015C2 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14501 000015C5 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14502 000015C7 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14503 000015CA 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14504                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14505                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14506                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14507 000015CC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14508                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14509                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14510                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14511                                  ok11_op:
 14512 000015CE FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14513 000015D2 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14514 000015D4 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14515                                  					; add 200h to address
 14516 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14517 000015D8 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14518 000015DA EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14519                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14520                                  
 14521                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14522                                  
 14523                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14524 000015DC F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14525                                  ok11_exit:
 14526 000015DD 5A                      		pop	dx
 14527 000015DE 59                      		pop	cx
 14528 000015DF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14529 000015E0 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14530                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14531                                  
 14532                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14533                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14534                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14535                                  
 14536                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14537 000015E2 06                      		push	es
 14538 000015E3 53                      		push	bx
 14539 000015E4 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14540 000015E7 1E                      		push	ds
 14541 000015E8 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14542 000015E9 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14543                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14544                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14545 000015EC 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14546                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14547 000015F1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14548 000015F2 07                      		pop	es
 14549 000015F3 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14550 000015F5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14551 000015F8 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14552                                  
 14553                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14554                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14555                                  
 14556                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14557 000015FA 56                      		push	si
 14558 000015FB 57                      		push	di
 14559 000015FC 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14560 000015FE BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14561 00001601 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14562 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14563 00001605 5E                      		pop	si
 14564 00001606 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14565                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14566                                  
 14567                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14568                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14569                                  
 14570                                  gotdmaerr:
 14571 00001608 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14572 0000160B FB                      		sti
 14573 0000160C 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14574 0000160F 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14575                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14576                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14577 00001611 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14578 00001614 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14579 00001616 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14580 00001619 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14581 0000161B 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14582                                  
 14583                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14584                                  
 14585                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14586                                  
 14587 0000161D 52                      		push	dx
 14588 0000161E 51                      		push	cx
 14589 0000161F 53                      		push	bx
 14590 00001620 50                      		push	ax
 14591 00001621 55                      		push	bp
 14592 00001622 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14593 00001624 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14594 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14595 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14596 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14597 0000162C D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14598 0000162E 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14599 00001630 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14600                                  
 14601                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14602                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14603                                  
 14604 00001634 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14605 00001636 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14606                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14607                                  
 14608                                  no_skip_first:
 14609 00001639 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14610 0000163B B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14611 0000163D 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14612                                  
 14613                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14614                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14615                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14616                                  ;
 14617                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14618                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14619                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14620                                  ; in error.
 14621                                  
 14622 0000163F 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14623 00001641 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14624                                  
 14625                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14626                                  
 14627 00001643 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14628                                  					; set up head number
 14629 00001646 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14630 00001649 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14632                                  
 14633                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14634 0000164C B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14635 0000164E F9                      		stc
 14636 0000164F E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14637                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14638                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14639                                  
 14640                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14641                                  
 14642                                  intverify:
 14643 00001652 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14644 00001653 53                      		push	bx
 14645 00001654 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14646 00001655 07                      		pop	es
 14647                                  dosimple:
 14648 00001656 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14649                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14650                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14651                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14652 00001659 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14653                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14654 0000165E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14655 0000165F 07                      		pop	es
 14656 00001660 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14658                                  
 14659                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14660                                  
 14661                                  intformat:
 14662 00001663 06                      		push	es
 14663 00001664 53                      		push	bx
 14664 00001665 56                      		push	si
 14665 00001666 57                      		push	di
 14666 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 14667                                  
 14668                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14669                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14670                                  
 14671 00001668 06                      		push	es
 14672 00001669 1E                      		push	ds
 14673 0000166A 07                      		pop	es
 14674 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds
 14675 0000166C 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14676 0000166E BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14677 00001671 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14678 00001674 1F                      		pop	ds
 14679 00001675 5F                      		pop	di
 14680 00001676 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14681 00001677 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14683                                  
 14684                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14685                                  ; the first block.
 14686                                  ;
 14687                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14688                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14689                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14690                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14691                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14692                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14693                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14694                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14695                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14696                                  
 14697                                  doblock:
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14700                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14701                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14702                                  				
 14703 00001679 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14704                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14705 0000167C 51                      		push	cx
 14706 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 14707 0000167E 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14708                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14709 0000167F E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14710 00001682 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14711                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14712 00001686 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14713                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14714 0000168B 5F                      		pop	di
 14715 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 14716 0000168D 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14717 0000168F 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14718 00001691 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14719 00001693 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14720                                  doblockflop:
 14721 00001695 59                      		pop	cx
 14722                                  doblockcontinue:
 14723 00001696 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14724 00001698 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14725 0000169A 50                      		push	ax
 14726 0000169B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14727 0000169D EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14728                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14729                                  
 14730                                  doblocklast:
 14731 0000169F 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14732 000016A1 50                      		push	ax
 14733                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14734 000016A2 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14735 000016A5 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14736 000016A7 58                      		pop	ax
 14737 000016A8 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14738                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14739 000016AB 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14740 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14741 000016AF 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14742 000016B1 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14743 000016B3 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14744                                  					; then we are done already.
 14745 000016B5 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14746                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14747 000016B7 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14748 000016BA EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14749                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14750                                  
 14751                                  bufferx:
 14752 000016BC 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14753                                  					; set up head number
 14754                                  buffer:
 14755 000016BF 53                      		push	bx
 14756 000016C0 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14757 000016C3 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14758 000016C6 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14759                                  
 14760                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14761                                  
 14762 000016C8 06                      		push	es
 14763 000016C9 1E                      		push	ds
 14764 000016CA 56                      		push	si
 14765 000016CB 57                      		push	di
 14766 000016CC 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14767 000016CD 06                      		push	es
 14768 000016CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 14769 000016CF 07                      		pop	es
 14770 000016D0 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14771 000016D3 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14772 000016D4 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14773 000016D6 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14774 000016D9 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14775                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14776 000016DA 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14777 000016DB 5E                      		pop	si
 14778 000016DC 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14779                                  
 14780                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14781                                  
 14782 000016DD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14783                                  					; get drive number
 14784 000016DF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14785 000016E2 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14786                                  					;
 14787                                  					; ah is	function
 14788                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14789                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14790                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14791                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14792                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14793 000016E5 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14794 000016E8 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14795 000016E9 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14796 000016EB EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14797                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14798                                  
 14799                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14800                                  
 14801                                  doread:
 14802 000016ED 06                      		push	es
 14803 000016EE 53                      		push	bx
 14804 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14805 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 14806 000016F1 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14807 000016F4 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14808 000016F6 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14809                                  					; get drive number
 14810 000016F9 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14811                                  					; ah = function
 14812                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14813                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14814                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14815 000016FC E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14816 000016FF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14817 00001700 07                      		pop	es
 14818 00001701 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14819 00001703 56                      		push	si
 14820 00001704 57                      		push	di
 14821 00001705 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14822 00001707 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14823 0000170A E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14824 0000170D 5F                      		pop	di
 14825 0000170E 5E                      		pop	si
 14826                                  
 14827                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14828                                  
 14829                                  dotail:
 14830 0000170F 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14831 00001710 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14832 00001713 41                      		inc	cx
 14833 00001714 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14834 00001717 F8                      		clc
 14835 00001718 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14836 0000171A 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14837                                  
 14838                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14839                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14840                                  
 14841 0000171C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14842 0000171F E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14843 00001722 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14844                                  
 14845                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14846                                  
 14847                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14848                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14849                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14850                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14851                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14852                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14853                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14854                                  
 14855                                  bad13:
 14856 00001725 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14857 00001727 5D                      		pop	bp
 14858 00001728 5B                      		pop	bx
 14859 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 14860 0000172A 59                      		pop	cx
 14861 0000172B 5A                      		pop	dx
 14862 0000172C 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14863 0000172E E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14864                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14865                                  
 14866                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 14867 00001731 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14868                                  
 14869                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14870                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14871                                  		;db 	0
 14872                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14873                                  
 14874                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14893                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14894                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14895                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14896                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14897                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14898                                  
 14899                                  install_bds:
 14900 00001740 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14901 00001741 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14902                                  
 14903                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14904                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14905                                  loop_next_bds:
 14906 00001744 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14907                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14908 00001746 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14909 0000174A 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14910                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14911 0000174D 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14912 0000174F B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14913 00001751 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14914                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14915 00001755 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14916 00001758 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14917                                  					; we don't own it
 14918 0000175D 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14919                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14920 00001760 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14921 00001763 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14922                                  next_bds:
 14923                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14924 00001767 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14925 0000176A 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14926                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14927                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14928 0000176C 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14929 0000176E 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14930                                  					; install bds
 14931 00001771 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14932 00001773 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14933                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14934                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14935 00001776 1F                      		pop	ds
 14936

 14941                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.

 14970                                  swpdsk:		
 14971 00001785 F606[6608]01            		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14972                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14973 0000178A 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14974                                  		
 14975                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14976                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14977                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14978 0000178C 9A[6708]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14979                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14980                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14981                                  no_win386:				
 14982 00001791 51                      		push	cx
 14983 00001792 52                      		push	dx
 14984 00001793 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14985                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14986                                  
 14987                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14988                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14989                                  
 14990 00001797 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14991 00001799 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14992 0000179C 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14993 0000179E B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14994                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14995                                  					; Broadcast it
 14996 000017A1 CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14997 000017A3 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14998 000017A4 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14999                                  
 15000                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 15001                                  
 15002 000017A6 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 15003                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15004 000017A9 2E8816[E317]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 15005                                  		; 16/10/2022
 15006                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 15007                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]

 15009 000017AE BE[C717]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 15010                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg

 15015                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 15016                                  wrmsg_loop:

 15018                                  					; AL = character to display

 15038                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
