 19795                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19796                                  ;
 19797                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19798                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19799                                  ;
 19800                                  ; Inputs : None
 19801                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19802                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19803                                  ;	   free memory.

 19805                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19806                                  ;
 19807                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20319                                  
 20320                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20321                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20322                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20323                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20324                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20325                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20326                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20327                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20328                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20329                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20330                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20331                                  ;
 20332                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20333                                  
 20334                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20335                                  update_arena:
 20336 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20337 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20338 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20339 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20340                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20341                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20342                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20343                                  	; ds = cs 
 20344 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20345 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20346 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20347                                  						;  before sysvar
 20348 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20349                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20350 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20351 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20352 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20353                                  
 20354                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20355 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20356 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es

 20397                                  ;
 20398                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20399                                  ;
 20400                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20401                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20402                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20403                                  ;
 20404                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20405                                  ;
 20406                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20407                                  
 20408                                  AllocHMA:
 20409                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20410                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20411                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20412                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20413                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20414                                  
 20415                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20416                                  ;
 20417                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20418                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20419                                  ;	push	ax
 20420                                  ;	popf
 20421                                  ;	pushf
 20422                                  ;	pop	ax
 20423                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20424                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20425                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20426                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20427                                  
 20428                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20429                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20430                                  
 20431 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 20432                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20433                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT

 20436 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20437                                  
 20438 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20439 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20440                                  
 20441 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20442 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20443                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20444                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20445                                  
 20446 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20447                                  	;mov	[0Eh],bx
 20448 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es

 20450

 20452 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh

 20455 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 20456 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA

 20458                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20459                                  
 20460 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 20461 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 20462                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 20463                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20464                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K

 20474 00000A8C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20

 20477 00000A91 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20478

 20480 00000A96 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 20567                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20568                                  ;
 20569                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20570                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20571                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20572                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20573                                  ;
 20574                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20575                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20576                                  ;
 20577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20578                                  
 20579                                  StartVDHead:
 20580                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20581                                  
 20582 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20583 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20584 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20585 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20586 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20587                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20588 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20589                                  VDiskSig1:
 20590 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20591                                  
 20592                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20593                                  
 20594 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20595                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20596 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20597 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20598 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20599                                  VDInt19:
 20600 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20601                                  OldVDInt19:
 20602 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20603                                  
 20604                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20605                                  
 20606                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20607 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20608                                  VDiskSig2:
 20609 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20610                                  
 20611                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20612                                  
 20613 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20614 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20615 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20616 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20617 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20618 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20619 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20620 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20621 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20622 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20623 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20624 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20625 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20626                                  
 20627                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20629                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20630                                  ;
 20631                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20632                                  ;
 20633                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20634                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20635                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20636                                  ;
 20637                                  ; Inputs : None
 20638                                  ;
 20639                                  ; Outputs : None
 20640                                  ;
 20641                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20642                                  ;
 20643                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20644                                  
 20645                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20646                                  
 20647                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20648 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20649 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20650                                  
 20651                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20652                                  
 20653                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20654 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20655                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20656 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20657 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20658                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20659 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20660                                  
 20661                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20662                                  
 20663 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20664                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20665                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20666 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20667 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20668                                  
 20669                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20670                                  
 20671 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20672 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20673                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20674 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20675                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20676 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20677 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20678 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20679                                  
 20680                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20681                                  
 20682 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20683                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20684 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20685 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20686                                  
 20687                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20688                                  
 20689                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20690 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20691 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20692 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20693 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20694 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20695 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20696 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20697 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20698                                  
 20699                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20700                                  
 20701                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20702 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20703 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20704                                  
 20705                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20706                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20707                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20708 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20709                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20710 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20711                                  
 20712 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20713                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20714 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20715 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20716 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20717                                  
 20718 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 20719 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20720                                  
 20721 00000B7B C3                      	retn

 20724                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20725                                  ;

 20767                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20768                                  
 20769                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20770                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20771                                  
 20772                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20773                                  
 20774                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20775                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20776                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20777                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20778                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20779                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20780                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20781                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20782                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20783                                  ;								     ;I070
 20784                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20785                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20786                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20787                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20788                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20789                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20790                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20791                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20792                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20793                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20794                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20795                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20796                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20797                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20798                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20799                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20800                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20801                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20802                                  
 20803                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20804                                  	; ds = cs
 20805                                  
 20806                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20807                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20808                                  
 20809 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 20810 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20811 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20812 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20813 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20814 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20815 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20816 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20817 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20818                                  
 20819                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20820                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20821                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20822                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20823                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20824                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20825                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20826 00000BDF A3[8E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20827                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20828 00000BE2 8816[900B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20829                                  
 20830 00000BE6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20831 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 20832 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es
 20833 00000BEB BE[7C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20834 00000BEE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20835 00000BF0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20836                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20837                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20838                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20839 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 20840 00000BF3 C3                      	retn

 20844                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20845                                  ;
 20846                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20847                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20848                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20849                                  ;		the offset.
 20850                                  ;
 20851                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20852                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20853                                  ;
 20854                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20855                                  
 20856                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20857                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20858 00000BF4 1E                      	push	ds
 20859 00000BF5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20860 00000BF8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20861                                  	;
 20862 00000BFA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20863 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20864                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20865 00000BFF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20866                                  	;
 20867 00000C02 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20868 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20869 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20870 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20871 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20872 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20873                                  	;
 20874                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20875                                  	;push	ds
 20876                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20877                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20878                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20879                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20880                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20881                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20882 00000C10 893E[8C08]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20883                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20884 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 20885 00000C15 C3                      	retn
 20886                                  
 20887                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20888                                  ;
 20889                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20890                                  ;
 20891                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20892                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 20893                                  ;
 20894                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 20895                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared
 20896                                  ;
 20897                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20898                                  
 20899                                  IsVDiskInstalled:

 20903                                  	;mov	si,VDiskSig1-StartVDHead ; 12h
 20904                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20905 00000C1E BE1200                  	mov	si,12h ; 18
 20906                                  	;mov	cx,VLEN1 ; 5
 20907 00000C21 B90500                  	mov	cx,5
 20908 00000C24 0E                      	push	cs
 20909 00000C25 07                      	pop	es
 20910 00000C26 BF[E20A]                	mov	di,VDiskSig1
 20911 00000C29 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 20912 00000C2B 740F                    	je	short ivdins_retn
 20913 00000C2D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20914 00000C30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20915                                  	;mov	si,10h+(VDiskSig2-VDiskHMAHead) ; 13h
 20916 00000C32 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h
 20917 00000C35 BF[070B]                	mov	di,VDiskSig2
 20918                                  	;;mov	cx,VLEN2  ; 5
 20919                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20920                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20922 00000C3A F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb

 20926                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20927                                  ;
 20928                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20929                                  ;
 20930                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20931                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20932                                  ;
 20933                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20934                                  
 20935                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20936                                  CPMHack:
 20937 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20938 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20939 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20940                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20941                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20942 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20943 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20944 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20945 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20946                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20947 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20948 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20949 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20950 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20951 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 21054                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21055                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21056                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 21057                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 21058                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 21059                                  ;	access them.
 21060                                  ;

 21067

 21069                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised

 21071                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 21072                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.

 21086                                  					; AX should be zero here

 21108                                  ;	if a non-fat based media is detected (by dpb.numberoffat == 0), then

 21853                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21854                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21855                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21856                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21857                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21858                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21859                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21860                                  ;
 21861                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21862                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21863                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21864                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21865                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21866                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21867                                  ;
 21868                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21869                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21870                                  ;
 21871                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21872                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21873                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21874                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21875                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21876                                  ;
 21877                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21878                                  ;
 21879                                  ;			  none.
 21880                                  
 21881                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21882                                  ;
 21883                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21884                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21885                                  
 21886                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21887                                  
 21888 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax

 21890 00000FE7 52                      	push	dx

 21902 00000FF5 42                      	inc	dx
 21903 00000FF6 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh

 21930 0000101A EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh

 21933 0000101D 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 22090                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22091                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22092                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22093                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22094                                  ;
 22095                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22096                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22097                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22098                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22099                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22100                                  ; program).
 22101                                  
 22102                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22103                                  
 22104                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22105                                  
 22106 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22107                                  
 22108                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22109                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22110                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22111                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22112                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22113                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22114                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22115                                  ; carridge return.
 22116                                  
 22117                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22118                                  ;character after =.
 22119                                  
 22120 000010CE 06                      	push	es
 22121 000010CF 1E                      	push	ds
 22122 000010D0 07                      	pop	es
 22123 000010D1 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22124 000010D2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22125                                  
 22126 000010D4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22127 000010D6 FC                      	cld
 22128 000010D7 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22129 000010DD BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22130                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22131 000010E0 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22132                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22133 000010E1 08C0                    	or	al,al
 22134                                  	;cmp	al,0
 22135 000010E3 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22136 000010E5 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22137                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22138 000010E7 AC                      	lodsb
 22139 000010E8 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22140 000010EB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22141 000010ED 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22142 000010EF FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22143 000010F1 47                      	inc	di
 22144 000010F2 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22145                                  done_installparm:
 22146 000010F4 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 22147                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22148 000010F9 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 22149                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 22150 000010FB 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 22151 000010FD 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 22152                                  					; starts with cr.
 22153                                  install_seg_set:
 22154                                  	; 05/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 22155 00001103 31DB                    	xor	bx, bx
 22156                                  	;mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment

 22160                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 22161                                  ;
 22162                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 22163                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 22164                                  ;
 22165                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 22166                                  ;
 22167                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 22168                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 22169                                  ; 	was fixed.

 22263                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22264                                  ;
 22265                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22266                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22267                                  ;
 22268                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22269                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22270                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22271                                  
 22272                                  ParaRound:
 22273 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22274 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22275 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22276 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22277 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22278 00001156 C3                      	retn

 22280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22281                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22282                                  ;
 22283                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22284                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22285                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22286                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22287                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22288                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22289                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22290                                  ;
 22291                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22292                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22293                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22294                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22295                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22296                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22297                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22298                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22299                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22300                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22301                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22302                                  ;
 22303                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22304                                  
 22305                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22306                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22307                                  sysinit_base:				
 22308 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22309 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22310 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22311 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22312 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22313 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22314 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22315 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22316                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22317                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22318 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22319 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22320 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22321                                  
 22322                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22323                                  
 22324 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22325 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22326 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22327                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22328                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22329                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22330 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22331                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22332 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22333                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22334                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22335                                  
 22336                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22337                                  stall:
 22338                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22339                                  _stall: 
 22340                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22341 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22342                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22343                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22344 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22345                                  
 22346                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22347 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22348                                  
 22349                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22350                                  
 22351                                  sum_up:
 22352                                  
 22353                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22354                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22355                                  ;
 22356                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22357                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22358                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22359                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22360                                  ;
 22361                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22362                                  
 22363 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22364                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22365                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22366 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22367                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22368                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22369 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22370 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22371 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22372 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22373                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22374 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22375 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22376                                  sum1:
 22377 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22378 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22379 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22380 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22381                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22382                                  sum_sys_code:
 22383                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22384 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22385                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22386                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22387                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22388                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22389                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22390                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22391                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22392 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22393 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22394 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22395                                  sum2:
 22396 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22397 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22398 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22399 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22400 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22401 000011B8 C3                      	retn

 22403                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)

 22405                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22406                                  
 22407                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)

 22412 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0

 22503                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22504                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22505                                  ;
 22506                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22507                                  ;
 22508                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22509                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 22513                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22514 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22515 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22516 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22517 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22518                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22519 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22520                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22521                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22522                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22523 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22524 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22525 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22526                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22527 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22528 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22529 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22530                                  
 22531                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22532                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22533                                  	; zf=1
 22534 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22535                                  	; zf=1
 22536                                  	
 22537                                  	;zf=1
 22538                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22539                                  	;zf=1
 22540 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22541                                  got_hma:
 22542 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 22543 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 22544 00001256 C3                      	retn

 22567 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 22569 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22570                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22571 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 22573                                  
 22574                                  ; ======================================================================
 22575                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22576                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22577                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22578                                  
 22579                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22580                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22581                                  ;
 22582                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22583                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22584                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22585                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22586                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22587                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22588                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22589                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22590                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22591                                  ;
 22592                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22593                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22594                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22595                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22596                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22597                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22598                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22599                                  ;	conditions:
 22600                                  ;
 22601                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22602                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22603                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22604                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22605                                  ;
 22606                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22607                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22608                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22609                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22610                                  ;
 22611                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22612                                  ;
 22613                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22614                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22615                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22616                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22617                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22618                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22619                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22620                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22621                                  ;
 22622                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22623                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22624                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22625                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22626                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22627                                  ;
 22628                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22629                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22630                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22631                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22632                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22633                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22634                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22635                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22636                                  ;
 22637                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22638                                  
 22639                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22640                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22641                                  
 22642                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22643                                  stackinit:
 22644 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22645 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22646 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22647 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22648 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22649 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22650 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22651 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22652 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22653                                  
 22654                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22655                                  
 22656                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22657                                  	; ds = cs
 22658 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22659 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22660                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22661                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22662                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22663 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22664                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22665 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22666 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22667                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22668 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22669                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22670                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22671                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22672 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22673                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22674 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22675 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22676                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22677                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22678                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22679 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22680                                  
 22681                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22682                                  
 22683                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22684                                  
 22685                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22686                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22687                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22688 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22689                                  
 22690                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22691                                  
 22692 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22693                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22694                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22695                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22696 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22697 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22698 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22699 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22700 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22701                                  
 22702                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22703                                  
 22704 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22705 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22706 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22707 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22708 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22709 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22710 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22711                                  
 22712                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22713                                  
 22714 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22715 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22716 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22717                                  
 22718 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22719                                  
 22720                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22721                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22722                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22723                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22724                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22725                                  
 22726                                  buildloop:
 22727                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22728                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22729                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22730                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22731                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22732 000012D9 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free

 22748 000012FC 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22749 00001300 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22750

 22752                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte

 22756 00001309 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22757 0000130E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22758 0000130F 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22759

 22761 00001313 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22762                                  
 22763                                  skip_disablenmis:
 22764 00001315 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22765 00001317 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 22766                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment

 23481                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23482                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23483                                  
 23484                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23485                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23486                                  
 23487                                  new_init_loop:
 23488                                  
 23489                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23490                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23491                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23492                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23493                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23494                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23495                                  
 23496 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23497 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23498 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23499 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23500                                  
 23501 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23502                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23503                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23504                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23505 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23506 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23507 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23508 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23509 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23510 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23511 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23512                                  
 23513 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23514 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23515 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23516                                  
 23517                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23520                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23521                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23522                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23523                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23524                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23525                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23526                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23527                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23528                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23529                                  
 23530                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23531                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)

 23533                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23534

 23536                                  
 23537                                  setdevmark:
 23538                                  
 23539                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23540                                  	;push	es
 23541                                  	;push	cx
 23542                                  
 23543 00001498 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23544 0000149D 2E890E[BB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23545 000014A2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23546                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23547                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23548 000014A4 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23549 000014A8 41                      	inc	cx
 23550                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23551 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23552                                  
 23553                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23554                                  	;pop	cx
 23555                                  	;pop	es
 23556                                  	
 23557 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23558 000014B3 C3                      	retn

 23761                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE

 23769                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
