 23798                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23799 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23800 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23801 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23802                                  endstruc
 23803                                  
 23804                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23805                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23806                                  ;
 23807                                  ;
 23808                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23809                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23810                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23811                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23812                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23813                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23814                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23815                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23816                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23817                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23818                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23819                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23820                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23821                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23822                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23823                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23824                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23825                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23826                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23827                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23828                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23829                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23830                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23831                                  ;	   :
 23832                                  ;
 23833                                  ;Note:
 23834                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23835                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23836                                  ;
 23837                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23838                                  ;
 23839                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23840                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23841                                  ;
 23842                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23843                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23844                                  ;
 23845                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23846                                  ;
 23847                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23848                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23849                                  ;
 23850                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23851                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23852                                  ;
 23853                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23854                                  ;
 23855                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23856                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23857                                  ;
 23858                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23859                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23860                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23861                                  ;
 23862                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23863                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23864                                  ;
 23865                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23866                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23867                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23869                                  
 23870                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23871                                  
 23872                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23873                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23874                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23875                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23876                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23877                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23878                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23879                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23880                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23881                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23882                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23883                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23884                                  
 23885                                  ;**** Function flags
 23886                                  
 23887                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23888                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23889                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23890                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23891                                  
 23892                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23893                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23894 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23895 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23896 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23897 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23898 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23899 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23900                                  endstruc
 23901                                  
 23902                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23903                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23904                                  ;
 23905                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23906                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23907                                  ;	     +-
 23908                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23909                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23910                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23911                                  ;	     |	:
 23912                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23913                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23914                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23915                                  ;	     |	:
 23916                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23917                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23918                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23919                                  ;	     +-	:
 23920                                  ;
 23921                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23922                                  ;
 23923                                  ;Note:
 23924                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23925                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23926                                  ;
 23927                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23928                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23929                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23931                                  
 23932                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23933                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23934                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23935                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23936                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23937                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23938                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23939                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23940                                  
 23941                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23942 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23943 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23944 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23945 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23946 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23947                                  endstruc
 23948                                  
 23949                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23950                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23951                                  ;
 23952                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23953                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23954                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23955                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23956                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23957                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23958                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23959                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23960                                  ;
 23961                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23962                                  ;
 23963                                  ;            +-
 23964                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23965                                  ;	    | or
 23966                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23967                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23968                                  ;	    | or
 23969                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23970                                  ;	    | or
 23971                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23972                                  ;	    | or
 23973                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23974                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23975                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23976                                  ;	    | or
 23977                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23978                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23979                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23980                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23981                                  ;	    +-
 23982                                  ;
 23983                                  ;
 23984                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23985                                  ;      list.
 23986                                  ;
 23987                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23988                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23989                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23990                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23991                                  
 23992                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23993                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk

 23996 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23997 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23998                                  endstruc

 24110                                  
 24111                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 24112                                  ; ======================================================================
 24113                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24114                                  
 24115                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24116                                  ; SysParse;
 24117                                  ;
 24118                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24119                                  ;
 24120                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24121                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24122                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24123                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24124                                  ;
 24125                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24126                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24127                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24128                                  ;
 24129                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24130                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24131                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24132                                  ;
 24133                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24134                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24135                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24136                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24137                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24138                                  ;
 24139                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24140                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24141                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24142                                  ;
 24143                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24144                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24145                                  ;
 24146                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24147                                  ;
 24148                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24149                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24150                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24151                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24152                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24153                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24154                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24155                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24156                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24157                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24158                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24159                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24160                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24161                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24162                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24163                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24164                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24165                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24166                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24167                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24168                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24169                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24170                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24171                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24172                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24173                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24174                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24175                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24176                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24177                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24178                                  
 24179                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24180                                  
 24181                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24182                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24183                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24184                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24185                                  
 24186                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24187                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24188                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24189                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24190                                  ;
 24191                                  
 24192                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24193                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24194                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24195                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24196                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24197                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24200                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24201                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24202                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24203                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24204                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24205                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24206                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24207                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24208                                  
 24209                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24210                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24211                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24212                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24213                                  ;	     segment.
 24214                                  
 24215                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24216                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24217                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24218                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24219                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24220                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24221                                  
 24222                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24223                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24224                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24225                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24226                                  
 24227                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24228                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24229                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24230                                  
 24231                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24232                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24233                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 24234                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 24235                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24236                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24237                                  
 24238                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24239                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24240                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24241                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24242                                  
 24243                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 24244                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 24245                                  
 24246                                  ;	     The code and PSDATA.INC have been aligned for ease of reading.
 24247                                  
 24248                                  ; 10/26/87 : Ed K (;AN026;) PTM2041, DATE within SWITCH, BX reference to
 24249                                  ;	     psdata buffer should have cs.
 24250

 24252                                  ;	     positional missing.
 24253

 24255                                  ;	     as a line delimiter, should use carriage return.
 24256                                  ;	     Define switch: LFEOLSW, if on, accept LF as end of line char.
 24257

 24812                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24813                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24814                                  ;
 24815                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24816                                  ;
 24817                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24818                                  ;	    AL = type
 24819                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24820                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24821                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24822                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24823                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24824                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24825                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24826                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24827                                  ;
 24828                                  ; Output:   None
 24829                                  ;
 24830                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24831                                  ;
 24832                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24833                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24834                                  
 24835                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24836 0000177B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24837 0000177C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24838                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24839 00001780 2E893E[C914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24840                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24841                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24842                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24843                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24844 00001785 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24845                                  
 24846 00001788 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24847 00001789 2EA1[D814]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24848 0000178D 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24849                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24850 00001791 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24851                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24852 00001792 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 24853 00001794 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 24854                                  
 24855                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;
 24856 00001796 26895504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dx ;AN000; then store 32bit
 24857 0000179A 26894D06                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val+2],cx ;AN000; number

 24859                                  
 24860                                  _$P_RLT00:				;AN000;

 24863

 25053                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25054                                  ;
 25055                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed

 25067 000018AD 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?

 25069

 25071 000018B3 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25072

 25074 000018BA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25075

 25078

 25081 000018C5 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 25094                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 25095                                  ;
 25096                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25097                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 25098                                  ;
 25099                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 25100                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 25101                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 25102                                  ;

 25104                                  ;
 25105                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 25106                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25107                                  
 25108                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 25109 000018CE 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25110 000018CF 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;

 25113 000018D2 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 25114 000018D5 E8FF03                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 25115 000018D8 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 25116                                  
 25117 000018DA 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25118 000018DC 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 25119                                  
 25120 000018DE E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 25121 000018E1 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 25122 000018E4 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 25123                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 25124 000018E6 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 25125                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 25126 000018E7 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 25127 000018E8 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25128                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 25129 000018EA 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25130 000018EB 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25131 000018EC C3                      	retn

 25227                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25228                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25229                                  ;
 25230                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25231                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25232                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25233                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25234                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25235                                  ;
 25236                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25237                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25238                                  ;
 25239                                  ; Output:    None
 25240                                  ;
 25241                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25242                                  ;
 25243                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25244                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25245                                  
 25246                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25247                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25248                                  
 25249                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25250                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25251                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25252 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 25531                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25532                                  ;
 25533                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25534                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25535                                  ;
 25536                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25537                                  ;
 25538                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25539                                  ;
 25540                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25541                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25542                                  
 25543                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25544                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25545 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25546 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25547 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25548                                  
 25549 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25550 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25551                                  
 25552                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25553 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25554 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25555                                  
 25556 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25557 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25558                                  
 25559                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25560 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25561 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26283                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26284                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26285                                  ;
 26286                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26287                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26288                                  ;
 26289                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26290                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26291                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26292                                  ;
 26293                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26294                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26295                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26296                                  
 26297                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26298                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26299                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26300                                  ;
 26301                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26302                                  
 26303                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26304                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26305                                  
 26306                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26307                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26308                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26309                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26310 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26311                                  
 26312                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26313 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26314 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26315                                  
 26316                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26317 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26318 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26319                                  
 26320 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26321                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26322                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26323 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26324                                  
 26325                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26326                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26327                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26328                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26329                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26330                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26331                                  
 26332                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26333                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26334 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26335 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26336                                  
 26337 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26338                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26339                                  
 26340                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26341                                  	; cf=0
 26342                                  	;retn
 26343                                  
 26344                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26345                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26346                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26347 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26348                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26349                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26350 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26404                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26405                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26406                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26407                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26408 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26409                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26410 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26411 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26412 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26413 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26414 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26415 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26416 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26417 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26418                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26419 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26420 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26421                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26422 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26423                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26424                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26425                                  	; cf=0
 26426                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26427                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26428 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26429 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26430 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26431 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26471                                  endstruc

 26997                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26998                                  
 26999                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27000                                  ;
 27001                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27002                                  ;
 27003                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27004                                  ;
 27005                                  ;   Modification log:
 27006                                  ;
 27007                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27008                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27009                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27010                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27011                                  ;
 27012                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27013                                  ;
 27014                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27015                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27016                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27017                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27018                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27019                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27020                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27021                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27022                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27023                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27024                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27025                                  ;
 27026                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27027                                  
 27028                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27029                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27030                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27031                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27032                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27033                                  
 27034                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27035                                  
 27036                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27037                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27038                                  
 27039                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27040                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27041                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27042                                  
 27043                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27044                                  ;
 27045                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27046                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27047                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 27048                                  ;	           line.
 27049                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27050                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27051                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27052                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27053                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27054                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27055                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 27056                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27057                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27058                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27059                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27060                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27061                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27062                                  ;	           for details).
 27063                                  
 27064 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27065 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27066 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27067 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27068 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27069 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27070 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27071 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27072 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27073                                  
 27074                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27075                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27076                                  
 27077                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27078                                  
 27079                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27080                                  
 27081                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27082

 27085                                  
 27086                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27087                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27088

 27090                                  
 27091 00001F5D 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded (paras)
 27092 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27093 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27094 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27095 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27096                                  ; 30/12/2022

 27098 00001F6B 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 style) InitDevLoad?
 27099                                  ;
 27100 00001F6C 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27101 00001F6D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 27102 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27103 00001F71 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
 27104                                  ;
 27105 00001F73 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 27106                                  ;
 27107 00001F77 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 27108 00001F79 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 27109                                  ;

 27113                                  ;
 27114 00001F7E 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12h ?
 27115 00001F7F 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12h ram)

 27135                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27136                                  ;
 27137                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27138                                  ;
 27139                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27140                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .

 27143                                  
 27144                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27145                                  doconf:
 27146 00001F91 0E                      	push	cs
 27147 00001F92 1F                      	pop	ds
 27148                                  
 27149 00001F93 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27150                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27151 00001F96 CD21                    	int	21h
 27152 00001F98 8816[3A46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27153                                  
 27154                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27155                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27156                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27157                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27158 00001F9C 8816[3846]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27159                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27160                                  
 27161 00001FA0 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ; now pointing to file description
 27162 00001FA3 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27163                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		; open file "config.sys"
 27164 00001FA6 F9                      	stc				; in case of int 24h
 27165 00001FA7 CD21                    	int	21h			; function request
 27166 00001FA9 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27167                                  
 27168                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27169                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27170                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27171 00001FAB E8F418                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27172                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27173                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27174 00001FAE C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27175 00001FB3 C3                      	retn
 27176                                  noprob: 				; get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27177 00001FB4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27178 00001FB6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27179 00001FB8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27180                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27181 00001FBA B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27182 00001FBD CD21                    	int	21h
 27183 00001FBF A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27184                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27185 00001FC2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27186                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27187                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27188                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27189                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27190                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27191                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27192 00001FC4 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27193 00001FC7 CD21                    	int	21h
 27194                                  
 27195                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27196 00001FC9 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27197                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27198                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27199                                  
 27200 00001FCD A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27201 00001FD0 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27202 00001FD3 E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27203 00001FD6 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27204                                  
 27205                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27206                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27207                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27208                                  ;
 27209                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27210                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27211                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27212                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27213                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27214                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27215                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27216                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27217                                  ;
 27218 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27219 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27220 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27221                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27222                                  
 27223 00001FDF 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27224                                  	
 27225                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27226 00001FE2 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27227 00001FE6 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27228                                  	
 27229                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27230                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27231                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27232                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27233                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27234                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27235                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]	
 27236                                  
 27237                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27238                                  	; ds = cs
 27239 00001FEA 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27240                                  
 27241 00001FEE 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27242 00001FF0 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27243                                  
 27244 00001FF2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27245                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27246                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27247 00001FF4 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27248                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27249 00001FF6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27250 00001FF7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27251 00001FF9 9C                      	pushf
 27252                                  
 27253                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27254                                  
 27255 00001FFA 50                      	push	ax
 27256 00001FFB 57                      	push	di
 27257 00001FFC 51                      	push	cx
 27258 00001FFD B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27259 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27260 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27261 00002003 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27262 00002005 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27263                                  
 27264                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27265                                  
 27266 00002007 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27267                                  
 27268                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27269                                  
 27270                                  puteol:
 27271 00002008 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27272 0000200A AA                      	stosb
 27273 0000200B B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27274 0000200D AA                      	stosb
 27275 0000200E 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27276                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27277                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27278                                  
 27279                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27280                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27281 00002010 0E                      	push	cs
 27282 00002011 1F                      	pop	ds
 27283                                  
 27284 00002012 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27285                                  
 27286 00002016 59                      	pop	cx
 27287 00002017 5F                      	pop	di
 27288 00002018 58                      	pop	ax
 27289                                  
 27290                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27291                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27292                                  	;push	cs
 27293                                  	;pop	ds
 27294                                  
 27295 00002019 50                      	push	ax
 27296                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27297 0000201A B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27298 0000201C CD21                    	int	21h
 27299 0000201E 58                      	pop	ax
 27300 0000201F 9D                      	popf
 27301 00002020 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;we've got a problem
 27302 00002022 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			; if ax <(>) cx
 27303 00002024 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27304                                  conferr:
 27305 00002026 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config		;print config error
 27306 00002029 E87924                  	call	badfil
 27307                                  	; 17/09/2023
 27308                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27309 0000202C C3                      	retn
 27310                                  
 27311                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27312                                  ;
 27313                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27314                                  ;
 27315                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 27318                                  
 27319                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27320                                  multi_pass:
 27321 0000202D 0E                      	push	cs
 27322 0000202E 1F                      	pop	ds
 27323                                  
 27324 0000202F 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27325                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27326 00002034 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27327                                  
 27328                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27329 00002036 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 27330                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27331                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27332 0000203A 07                      	pop	es			; es = [confbot] (CONFIG.SYS image seg)
 27333                                  
 27334 0000203B 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27335 0000203F 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27336 00002043 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27337 00002045 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27338 00002049 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount

 27395                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27396                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27397                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27398                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27399                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27400                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27401                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27402                                  ;   spot.
 27403                                  ;
 27404                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27405                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27406                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27407                                  ;   retrieved.

 27608                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27609                                  ;									      *
 27610                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27611                                  ;									      *
 27612                                  ; input :								      *
 27613                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27614                                  ; output:								      *
 27615                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27616                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27617                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27618                                  ;									      *
 27619                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27620                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27621                                  ; logic:								      *
 27622                                  ; {									      *
 27623                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27624                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27625                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27626                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27627                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27628                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27629                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27630                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27631                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27632                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27633                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27634                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27635                                  ;	};								      *
 27636                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27637                                  ; };									      *
 27638                                  ;									      *
 27639                                  ;******************************************************************************

 27731                                  ; break command
 27732                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27733                                  
 27734                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27735                                  ;									    *
 27736                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27737                                  ;									    *
 27738                                  ; input :								    *
 27739                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27740                                  ; output:								    *
 27741                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27742                                  ;									    *
 27743                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27744                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27745                                  ; logic:								    *
 27746                                  ; {									    *
 27747                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27748                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27749                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27750                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27751                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27752                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27753                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27754                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27755                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27756                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27757                                  ;	};								    *
 27758                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27759                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27760                                  ; };									    *

 27763

 27773                                  ;%if 0
 27774                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27775 000021B8 E8DE1E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27776 000021BB 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27777                                  ;endif
 27778                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27779                                  
 27780 000021BD BF[771D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27781 000021C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27782                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27783                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27784                                  do22:
 27785 000021C2 E81F07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27786 000021C5 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27787                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27788                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27789                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27790                                  ;sr22:

 27792                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27793 000021C7 E94906                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27794                                  if22:
 27795 000021CA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27796 000021CD 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop

 27821                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27822                                  ; multitrack command
 27823                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27824                                  
 27825                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27826                                  ;									      *
 27827                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 27828                                  ;									      *
 27829                                  ; input :								      *
 27830                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27831                                  ; output:								      *
 27832                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 27833                                  ;									      *
 27834                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27835                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27836                                  ; logic:								      *
 27837                                  ; {									      *
 27838                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 27839                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27840                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27841                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27842                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27843                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 27844                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 27845                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 27846                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 27847                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 27848                                  ;	};								      *
 27849                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 27850                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 27851                                  ;									      *
 27852                                  ; };									      *
 27853                                  ;									      *
 27854                                  ;******************************************************************************
