 29344                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29345                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29346                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29347                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29348                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29349                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29350                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29351                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29352                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29353                                  
 29354                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29355                                  ;									  *
 29356                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29357                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29358                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29359                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29360                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29361                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29362                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29363                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29364                                  ; input :								  *
 29365                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29366                                  ; output:								  *
 29367                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29368                                  ;									  *
 29369                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29370                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29371                                  ; logic:								  *
 29372                                  ; {									  *
 29373                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29374                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29375                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29376                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29377                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29378                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29379                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29380                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29381                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29382                                  ;	     }								  *
 29383                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29384                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29385                                  ;	};								  *
 29386                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29387                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29388                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29389                                  ; };									  *
 29390                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30137                                  sysinit_parse:
 30138                                  
 30139                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30140                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30141                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30142                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30143                                  ;
 30144                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30145                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30146                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30147                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30148                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30149                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30150                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30151                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30152                                  ;	 procedure.
 30153                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30154                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30155                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30156                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30157                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30158                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30159                                  
 30160                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30161                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)

 30505                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30506                                  ;
 30507                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30508                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30509                                  ;
 30510                                  ;	Output : none
 30511                                  ;
 30512                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30513                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30514                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30515                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30516                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30527 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30528                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30529                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30530                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 30546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30547                                  ;
 30548                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30549                                  ;
 30550                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30551                                  ;	Output : none
 30552                                  ;
 30553                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30554                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30555                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30556                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30557                                  ;
 30558                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30559                                  
 30560                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30561                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30562 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30563 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30564 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30565 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30566 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30567 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30568 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30569 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30570 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30571 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30572                                  ;limx:
 30573 000029B8 C3                      	retn

 30580                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying

 30582                                  ;

 30586                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying

 30595                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30596                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30597 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30598                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30599 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30600 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30601                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30602                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0

 30604                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30605 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30606 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30663                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30664                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30665                                  
 30666                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30667                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30668                                  
 30669                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30670                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30671                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30672                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30673                                  
 30674                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30675                                  ;
 30676                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30677                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30678                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30679                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30680                                  ;
 30681                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30682                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30683                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30684                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30685                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30686                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30687                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30688                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30689                                  ; available during the load.
 30690                                  ;
 30691                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30692                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30693                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30694                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30695                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30696                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30697                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30698                                  ;
 30699                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30700                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30701                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30702                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30703                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30704                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30705                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30706                                  ;
 30707                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30708                                  
 30709                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30710                                  
 30711                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30712                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30713                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30714                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30715                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30716                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30717                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30718                                  
 30719                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30720                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30721                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30722                                  
 30723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30724                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30725                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30726                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30727                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30728                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30729                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30730                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30731                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30732                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30733                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30734                                  
 30735                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 30745                                  	;push	cx
 30746                                  	;push	di
 30747 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30748

 30750 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs

 30753 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30754                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)

 30793                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30794                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30795                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30796                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30797                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30798                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30799                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30800                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30801                                  
 30802                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30803                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30804                                  FixMem:
 30805                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30806                                  	;push	ax
 30807                                  	;push	bx
 30808                                  	;push	cx
 30809                                  	;push	dx
 30810 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30811                                  
 30812 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30813                                  
 30814 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30815 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30816                                  
 30817 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30818                                  
 30819                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30820                                  
 30821 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30822 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30823 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30824                                  
 30825                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30826                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30827                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30828                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30829                                  
 30830 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30831 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30832 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30833 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30834                                  
 30835                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30836                                  
 30837 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30838 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30839 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30840                                  
 30841 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30842                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30843                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30844 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30845 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30846                                  
 30847                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30848                                  
 30849 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30850 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30851                                  
 30852 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30853                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30854 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30855 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30856 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30857                                  
 30858                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30859 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30860 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30861                                  fmX:	
 30862 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30863                                  
 30864 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30865                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30866                                  	;pop	dx
 30867                                  	;pop	cx
 30868                                  	;pop	bx
 30869                                  	;pop	ax
 30870                                  
 30871 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30872                                  
 30873                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30874                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30875                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30876                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30877                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30878                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30879                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30880                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30881                                  
 30882                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30883                                  fm_link:
 30884 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30885 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30886                                  
 30887                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30888                                  	;
 30889                                  	;push	es
 30890                                  	;push	cs
 30891                                  	;pop	es
 30892                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30893                                  	;pop	es
 30894                                  	
 30895                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30896                                  	; ds = cs
 30897                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30898 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30899                                  
 30900 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30901 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30902 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30903 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 30904                                  
 30905                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30906                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30907                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30908                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30909                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30910                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30911                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30912                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30913

 30915                                  fm_unlink:
 30916 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30917                                  	
 30918                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30919                                  	;
 30920                                  	;push	ds
 30921                                  	;push	cs
 30922                                  	;pop	ds
 30923                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30924                                  	;pop	ds
 30925                                  	
 30926                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30927                                  	; ds = cs
 30928                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30929 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30930                                  
 30931 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30932 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30933 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 30934

 30937                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30938                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30939                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30940                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30941                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30942                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30943                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30944                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30945                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30946                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30947                                  ;
 30948                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30949                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30950                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30951                                  ;
 30952                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30953                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30954                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30955                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30956                                  ;
 30957                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30958                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30959                                  ;
 30960                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30961                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30962                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30963                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30964                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30965                                  ;     lh
 30966                                  ;     /l
 30967                                  ;     1
 30968                                  ;     1000
 30969                                  ;     2
 30970                                  ;     print
 30971                                  ;     /d
 30972                                  ;     :lpt2
 30973                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30974                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30975                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30976                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30977                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30978                                  ; for:
 30979                                  ;    Each /L
 30980                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30981                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30982                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30983                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30984                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30985                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30986                                  
 30987                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30988                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30989                                  
 30990                                  ParseVar:
 30991                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30992                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30993                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30994 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 30995 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 30996                                  
 30997 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30998 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30999 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 31000                                  
 31001                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31002                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31003                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31004                                  
 31005 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31006 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31007 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31008                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31009 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31010 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31011                                  
 31012 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31013 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31014 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31015                                  pv20:	
 31016 00002AA2 AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31017                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31018 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31019                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31020 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31021 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31022                                  
 31023                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31024 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31025                                  
 31026                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31027                                  	;
 31028                                  	;push	es
 31029                                  	;push	cs
 31030                                  	;pop	es
 31031                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31032                                  	;pop	es
 31033                                  
 31034 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31035                                  
 31036 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31037                                  
 31038                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31039 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 31040 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 31041                                  
 31042                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31043 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31044                                  
 31045 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31046 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31047                                  
 31048 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31049 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31050                                  
 31051                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31052 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31053 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31054 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 31055 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 31056                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31057 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 31058 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31059                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31060                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31061 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 31062                                  
 31063                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31064                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31065                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31066                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31067                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31068                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31069                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31070                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31071                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31072                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31073                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 31074                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31075                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31076                                  
 31077                                  parseL:
 31078 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 31079 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31080 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31081                                  
 31082                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31083                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31084                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31085                                  
 31086 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31087 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31088 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31089                                  
 31090 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31091 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31092 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31093                                  
 31094                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31095 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31096                                  
 31097 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 31098 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31099 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31100                                  
 31101 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31102 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31103                                  
 31104 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31105 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31106                                  
 31107                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31108 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31109 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31110                                  
 31111 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31112 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31113                                  
 31114                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31115                                  
 31116 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31117 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31118                                  
 31119 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31120                                  
 31121 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31122                                  
 31123                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31124 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31125                                  
 31126 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 31127 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31128 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31129                                  
 31130 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31131 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31132                                  
 31133 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31134 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31135                                  
 31136                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31137 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31138 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31139                                  plE1:	
 31140                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31141 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31142 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 31143 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 31144 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 31145                                  
 31146                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31147 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31148                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31149                                  	; cf=1
 31150                                  	;stc
 31151 00002B2C C3                      	retn
 31152                                  plSwX:	
 31153 00002B2D 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31154                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31155                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31156                                  	; cf=0
 31157                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31158 00002B2E C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31159                                  
 31160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31161                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 31162                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31163                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31164                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31165                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31166                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 31167                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31168                                  
 31169                                  ;incArgc:

 31171                                  
 31172                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 31173                                  
 31174                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 31175                                  
 31176                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 31177                                  
 31178                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 31179                                  
 31180                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 31181                                  
 31182                                  	;pop	ax
 31183                                  	;retn
 31184                                  
 31185                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31186                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31187                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31188                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31189                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31190                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31191                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31192                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31193                                  
 31194                                  isEOL:
 31195 00002B2F 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31196 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31197 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31198 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31199 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31200                                  ieX:	
 31201 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 31202                                  
 31203                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31272                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31273                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31274                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31275                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31276                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31277                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31278                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31279                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31280                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31281                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31282                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31283                                  
 31284                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31285                                  stowUMB:
 31286 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31287 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31288 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31289 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB # >= MAXUMB
 31290                                  su10:	
 31291                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31292                                  	;push	bx
 31293                                  	;push	di
 31294                                  	;push	si
 31295                                  	;push	ds
 31296                                  	;push	es
 31297                                  	;push	cs
 31298                                  	;pop	es
 31299                                  	;push	cs
 31300                                  	;pop	ds
 31301                                  
 31302                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31303                                  	; ds <> cs
 31304                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31305 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31306                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31307 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31308 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31309                                  
 31310                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31311                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31312                                  	;jne	short su20
 31313                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31314                                  su20:	
 31315 00002B6A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31316 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.

 31331                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 31333                                  	;stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 31334

 31337 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31338                                  su30:	
 31339                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31340                                  	;pop	es
 31341                                  	;pop	ds
 31342                                  	;pop	si
 31343                                  	;pop	di
 31344                                  	;pop	bx
 31345 00002B7C C3                      	retn

 31385                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31386                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31387                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31388                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31389                                  ; A-F are considered valid if gnradix is 16.
 31390                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31391                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31392                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31393                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31394                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31395                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31396                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31397                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31398                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31400                                  
 31401                                  gnradix:
 31402 00002B7D 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31403                                  
 31404                                  toDigit:
 31405 00002B7F 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31406 00002B85 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31407                                  
 31408                                  toDigit_hex:
 31409 00002B87 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31410 00002B8A 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31411 00002B8C 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31412 00002B8F 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'f' at all...
 31413 00002B91 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31414                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31415 00002B94 C3                      	retn
 31416                                  td10:	
 31417 00002B95 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31418 00002B98 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'? Not a letter...
 31419 00002B9A 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31420 00002B9D 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'? Not a digit.
 31421 00002B9F 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31422                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31423 00002BA2 C3                      	retn
 31424                                  toDigit_dec:
 31425                                  td20:	
 31426 00002BA3 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31427                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31428 00002BA6 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31429 00002BA8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31430 00002BAB 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31431 00002BAD 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31432                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31433 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 31434                                  tdE:	
 31435 00002BB1 F9                      	stc
 31436                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31437 00002BB2 C3                      	retn
 31438                                  
 31439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31440                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31442                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31443                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31444                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31445                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31446                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31447                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31448                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31449                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31450                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31451                                  
 31452                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31453                                  
 31454                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31455                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31456                                  
 31457                                  GetXNum:
 31458                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31459                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31460                                  	;push	bx
 31461 00002BB3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31462                                  	;push	ds
 31463                                  
 31464 00002BB4 FC                      	cld
 31465 00002BB5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31466 00002BB7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31467 00002BB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31468 00002BBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31469                                  
 31470 00002BBD 2EC706[7D2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31471                                  
 31472 00002BC4 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31473                                  	;call	toDigit
 31474 00002BC7 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31475                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31476                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31477 00002BCA 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31478                                  
 31479 00002BCC 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31480 00002BCE 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31481 00002BD0 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31482 00002BD4 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31483 00002BD7 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31484 00002BD9 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31485 00002BDC 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31486                                  
 31487                                  gxn10:	
 31488 00002BDE 2EC706[7D2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31489 00002BE5 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31490 00002BE6 46                      	inc	si
 31491                                  
 31492                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31493                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31494                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31495                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31496                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31497                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31498                                  
 31499                                  gxn20:	
 31500 00002BE7 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31501 00002BEA 46                      	inc	si
 31502                                  
 31503 00002BEB E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31504 00002BEE 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31505                                  
 31506 00002BF0 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31507 00002BF3 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31508                                  
 31509 00002BF5 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31510 00002BF7 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 31511                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31512                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31513 00002BF9 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31514                                  gxnE:	
 31515                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31516 00002BFB EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31517                                  gxnQ:	
 31518 00002BFD 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31519 00002BFE F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31520                                  gxnX:	
 31521                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31522                                  	;pop	ds
 31523 00002BFF 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31524                                  	;pop	bx
 31525 00002C00 C3                      	retn
 31526                                  
 31527                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31528                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31529                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31530                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31531                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31532                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31533                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31534                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31535                                  
 31536                                  mul32:
 31537 00002C01 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31538 00002C02 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31539 00002C04 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31540 00002C09 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31541                                  
 31542 00002C0B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31543 00002C0D 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31544                                  
 31545 00002C0E 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31546 00002C10 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31547 00002C15 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31548 00002C17 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31549 00002C19 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31550 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 31551                                  m32E:	
 31552 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax
 31553 00002C1D C3                      	retn
 31554                                  
 31555                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31556                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31558                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31559                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31560                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31561                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31562                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31563                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31564                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31565                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31566                                  
 31567                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31568                                  toPara:
 31569 00002C1E 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31570                                  
 31571 00002C1F B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31572 00002C21 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31573 00002C23 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31574 00002C24 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31575 00002C26 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31576 00002C28 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31577                                  
 31578 00002C2A 59                      	pop	cx
 31579 00002C2B C3                      	retn

 31582                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31583                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31585                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31586                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31587                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31588                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31589                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31590                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31591                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31592                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31593                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31594                                  
 31595                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31596                                  UmbHead:

 31602                                  	;push	bx ; *

 31606                                  
 31607 00002C2C B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31608 00002C2E CD21                    	int	21h
 31609                                  
 31610 00002C30 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31611                                  	
 31612                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31613 00002C34 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31614 00002C37 F5                      	cmc
 31615                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31616 00002C38 C3                      	retn

 31667                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31668                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31669                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31670                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31671                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31672                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31673                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31674                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31675                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31676                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31677                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31678                                  ;      ...
 31679                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31680                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31681                                  
 31682                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31683                                  AddrToUmb:
 31684                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31685                                  	;push	cx
 31686                                  	;push	dx
 31687 00002C49 06                      	push	es
 31688                                  
 31689 00002C4A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31690                                  
 31691 00002C4C E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31692 00002C4F 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31693                                  
 31694                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31695                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31696 00002C51 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31697                                  
 31698                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31699                                  atu10:
 31700 00002C53 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 31701                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31702                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31703                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31704                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31705                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31706                                  
 31707                                  ;atu10:	
 31708                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 31709 00002C55 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31710 00002C57 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31711                                  
 31712 00002C59 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31713 00002C5C 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31714                                  
 31715 00002C5E 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31716                                  atu20:	
 31717                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31718                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31719                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31720                                  	; ax = es
 31721                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31722 00002C5F 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31723 00002C64 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31724 00002C6A 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31725                                  
 31726                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31727                                  
 31728                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31729                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31730                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31731 00002C6C 40                      	inc	ax
 31732                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31733                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31734 00002C6D EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31735                                  
 31736                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31737                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31738                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31739                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31740                                  
 31741                                  atu30:	
 31742                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31743                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31744                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31745                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31746 00002C6F 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31747 00002C71 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31748                                  atuE:	
 31749 00002C73 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31750 00002C75 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31751                                  atuX:	
 31752 00002C76 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31753                                  	
 31754 00002C78 07                      	pop	es	
 31755                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31756                                  	;pop	dx
 31757                                  	;pop	cx
 31758 00002C79 C3                      	retn
 31759                                  
 31760                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31761                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31762                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31763                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31764                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31765                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31766                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31767                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31768                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31769                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31770                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31771                                  
 31772                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31773                                  convUMB:
 31774 00002C7A 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31775 00002C80 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31776 00002C82 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31777                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31778                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31779                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31780                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31781 00002C85 40                      	inc	ax
 31782 00002C86 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31783 00002C88 48                      	dec	ax
 31784                                  cu10:	
 31785 00002C89 C3                      	retn
 31786

 31821                                  ; ERROR:  None

 31856                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was

 32201 00002CEF 741F                    	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 32202                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0

 32212 00002D02 740C                    	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32213                                  
 32214                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 32215 00002D04 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 32216                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 32217 00002D06 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32218 00002D0B 40                      	inc     ax
 32219 00002D0C 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 32220                                  
 32221 00002D0E EBDC                    	jmp	short hu10
 32222                                  huX:	
 32223 00002D10 07                      	pop	es
 32224                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32225                                  	;pop	ax
 32226                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32227 00002D11 5A                      	pop	dx ; (*)
 32228 00002D12 C3                      	retn
