 34465 00003385 B452                    	mov	ah,52h
 34466 00003387 CD21                    	int	21h			; get DOS DATA seg
 34467                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34468                                  	; ds = cs
 34469                                  	;mov	[cs:DevDOSData],es	; & save it for later
 34470 00003389 8C06[8A1F]              	mov	[DevDOSData],es		; & save it for later
 34471 0000338D B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 34472 00003390 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 34473                                  	;mov	[cs:DevXMSAddr],bx	; get XMS driver address
 34474                                  	;mov	[cs:DevXMSAddr+2],es
 34475 00003392 891E[731F]              	mov	[DevXMSAddr],bx		; get XMS driver address
 34476 00003396 8C06[751F]              	mov	[DevXMSAddr+2],es	
 34477                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34478 0000339A 803E[891F]00            	cmp	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0 
 34479                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0 ; have we already linked a UMB?
 34480                                  	;jne	short ia_1		; quit if we already did it
 34481                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34482 0000339F 770A                    	ja	short ia_1 ; cf=0
 34483 000033A1 E83900                  	call	LinkFirstUMB		; else link the first UMB
 34484                                  	;jc	short iau_err
 34485                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34486 000033A4 7207                    	jc	short iau_err2  ; cf=1
 34487                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34488                                  	; ds = cs
 34489 000033A6 C606[891F]FF            	mov	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0FFh ; mark that 1st UMB linked
 34490                                  	;mov	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0FFh ; mark that 1st UMB linked
 34491                                  ia_1:
 34492                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34493                                  	; cf=0
 34494                                  	;clc
 34495 000033AB C3                      	retn
 34496                                  iau_err:
 34497 000033AC F9                      	stc
 34498                                  iau_err2:
 34499 000033AD C3                      	retn
 34500                                  
 34501                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34502                                  ;
 34503                                  ; Procedure Name	: umb_allocate
 34504                                  ;
 34505                                  ; Inputs		: DS = data
 34506                                  ;
 34507                                  ; Outputs		: if UMB available
 34508                                  ;				Allocates the largest available UMB and 
 34509                                  ;			  	BX = segment of allocated block
 34510                                  ;				DX = size of allocated block
 34511                                  ;				NC
 34512                                  ;			  else 
 34513                                  ;				CY
 34514                                  ;
 34515                                  ; Uses			: BX, DX
 34516                                  ;
 34517                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34518                                  
 34519                                  umb_allocate:
 34520                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34521                                  	; ds = cs
 34522 000033AE 50                      	push	ax
 34523 000033AF B410                    	mov	ah,XMM_REQUEST_UMB ; 16
 34524 000033B1 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh		; try to allocate largest
 34525                                  					;   possible
 34526                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34527 000033B4 FF1E[731F]              	call	far [DevXMSAddr]
 34528                                  	;call	far [cs:DevXMSAddr]
 34529                                  					; dx now contains the size of
 34530                                  					; the largest UMB
 34531 000033B8 09D2                    	or	dx,dx
 34532 000033BA 740B                    	jz	short ua_err
 34533                                  	
 34534 000033BC B410                    	mov	ah,XMM_REQUEST_UMB ; 16
 34535                                  
 34536                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34537 000033BE FF1E[731F]              	call	far [DevXMSAddr]
 34538                                  	;call	far [cs:DevXMSAddr]
 34539                                  
 34540 000033C2 83F801                  	cmp	ax,1			; Q: was the reqst successful
 34541                                  	;jne	short ua_err		; N: error
 34542                                  	; 27/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 34543 000033C5 7601                    	jna	short ua_done ; if ax=1 then cf=0, else cf=1 (ax=0)
 34544                                  ua_err:
 34545 000033C7 F9                      	stc	
 34546                                  
 34547                                  	;clc
 34548                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34549                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34550                                  	; cf=0
 34551                                  	;clc 
 34552                                  ua_done:
 34553 000033C8 58                      	pop	ax
 34554 000033C9 C3                      	retn
 34555                                  	; 27/07/2023
 34556                                  ;ua_err:
 34557                                  	;stc
 34558                                  	;jmp	short ua_done
 34559                                  
 34560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34561                                  ;
 34562                                  ;**	get_next - Find Next item in Arena
 34563                                  ;
 34564                                  ;	ENTRY	dS - pointer to block head
 34565                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 34566                                  ;		'C' set if arena damaged
 34567                                  ;
 34568                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34569                                  
 34570                                  	; 01/11/2022
 34571                                  get_next:
 34572 000033CA 803E00005A              	cmp	byte [0],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 34573 000033CF 740A                    	je	short gn_err
 34574                                  _get_next_:
 34575 000033D1 8CD8                    	mov     ax,ds                   ; ax=current block
 34576 000033D3 03060300                	add     ax,[ARENA.SIZE]		; ax=ax + current block length
 34577 000033D7 40                      	inc     ax                      ; remember that header!
 34578 000033D8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 34579                                  	;clc
 34580                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34581                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34582                                  	; cf=0
 34583                                  	;clc
 34584 000033DA C3                      	retn
 34585                                  gn_err:
 34586 000033DB F9                      	stc
 34587                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 34588                                  lfu_err:	 ; cf=1
 34589 000033DC C3                      	retn

 34591                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34592                                  ;
 34593                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 34594                                  ;
 34595                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34596                                  
 34597                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34598                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 34599                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 34600                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34601                                  	; ds = cs

 34603 000033E0 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 34604                                  
 34605                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 34606                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 34607                                  
 34608                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34609                                  	; ds = cs
 34610                                  
 34611 000033E2 CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 34612 000033E4 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 34613 000033E6 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 34614                                  
 34615 000033E8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 34616 000033EA 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 34617                                  
 34618 000033EC F7D8                    	neg	ax
 34619                                  
 34620                                  	;sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 34621                                  	; 09/09/2023
 34622 000033EE 49                      	dec	cx
 34623 000033EF 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 34624                                  	
 34625 000033F1 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 34626 000033F7 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 34627                                  					
 34628 000033FE 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 34629 00003402 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 34630                                  
 34631                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 34632                                  
 34633 00003409 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 34634 0000340B 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 34635 00003411 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 34636                                  					; mark as free 
 34637 00003418 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 34638 00003419 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 34639                                  
 34640                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 34641                                  	; 31/12/2022
 34642 0000341E 8E06[8A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 34643                                  	; 18/09/2023
 34644 00003422 26890E8C00              	mov	[es:UMB_ARENA],cx
 34645                                  	;mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 34646                                  	;mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 34647                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 34648                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 34649                                  
 34650                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 34651

 34657                                  ;scan_next

 34682                                  
 34683                                  ; 11/12/2022

 34689                                  ;	;stc

 34692                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34693                                  ;
 34694                                  ; procedure : ShrinkUMB
 34695                                  ;
 34696                                  ;	Shrinks the current UMB in use, so that the unused portions
 34697                                  ;	of the UMB is given back to the DOS free mem pool
 34698                                  ;
 34699                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34700                                  
 34701                                  ShrinkUMB:
 34702                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34703                                  	; ds = cs
 34704 0000344C 833E[6D1F]00            	cmp	word [DevUMBAddr],0
 34705                                  	;cmp	word [cs:DevUMBAddr],0
 34706 00003451 741F                    	je	short su_exit
 34707 00003453 06                      	push	es
 34708                                  	; 01/01/2023
 34709                                  	;push	bx
 34710                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34711                                  	;mov	bx,[cs:DevUMBFree]
 34712                                  	;sub	bx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 34713                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 34714 00003454 8B1E[711F]              	mov	bx,[DevUMBFree]
 34715 00003458 2B1E[6D1F]              	sub	bx,[DevUMBAddr]
 34716 0000345C 8E06[6D1F]              	mov	es,[DevUMBAddr]
 34717                                  	
 34718 00003460 B8004A                  	mov	ax,4A00h
 34719 00003463 CD21                    	int	21h
 34720                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 34721                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 34722                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 34723 00003465 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 34724 00003467 48                      	dec	ax
 34725 00003468 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 34726 0000346A 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8
 34727                                  	; 01/01/2023
 34728                                  	;pop	bx
 34729 00003471 07                      	pop	es
 34730                                  su_exit:
 34731 00003472 C3                      	retn

 34748                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0

 34750                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34751 0000347C 8E06[8A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 34752                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]	; get DOS data seg
 34753 00003480 268E1E2400              	mov	ds,[es:DOS_ARENA]
 34754 00003485 268B3E8C00              	mov	di,[es:UMB_ARENA]
 34755                                  ulu_next:
 34756 0000348A E83DFF                  	call	get_next
 34757 0000348D 720D                    	jc	short ulu_x

 34759 00003491 7404                    	je	short ulu_found

 34770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34771                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 34772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34773                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34774                                  
 34775                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34776                                  ;
 34777                                  ; Summary:
 34778                                  ;
 34779                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 34780                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 34781                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 34782                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 34783                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 34784                                  ;
 34785                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 34786                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 34787                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 34788                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 34789                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 34790                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 34791                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 34792                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 34793                                  ;
 34794                                  ; Example:
 34795                                  ;
 34796                                  ;   [menu]
 34797                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 34798                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 34799                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 34800                                  ;
 34801                                  ;   [network]
 34802                                  ;   include misc
 34803                                  ;   device=foo
 34804                                  ;
 34805                                  ;   [misc]
 34806                                  ;   device=bar
 34807                                  ;   include alternate
 34808                                  ;
 34809                                  ;   [alternate]
 34810                                  ;   device=tar
 34811                                  ;
 34812                                  ;
 34813                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 34814                                  ;
 34815                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 34816                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 34817                                  ;
 34818                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 34819                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 34820                                  ;   following order:
 34821                                  ;
 34822                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 34823                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 34824                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 34825                                  ;
 34826                                  
 34827                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 34828                                  
 34829                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 34830                                  
 34831                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 34832                                  
 34833                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 34834                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 34835                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 34836                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 34837                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 34838                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 34839                                  
 34840                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34841                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34842                                  
 34843                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 34844                                  
 34845                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34846                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 34847                                  
 34848 0000349F 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0

 34984                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34985                                  ;
 34986                                  ; procedure : parseline
 34987                                  ;
 34988                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 34989                                  ;
 34990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34991                                  
 34992                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 34993                                  	; (SYSINIT:3EDFh)
 34994                                  
 34995                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34996                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 34997                                  parseline:
 34998                                  	; 03/01/2023
 34999                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 35000                                  
 35001                                  	;push	ds ; *
 35002                                  
 35003                                  	;push	cs ; *
 35004                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 35005                                  
 35006                                  nextswtch:
 35007                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 35008                                  	je	short done_line
 35009                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 35010                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 35011                                  
 35012                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 35013                                  
 35014                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 35015                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 35016                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 35017                                  	je	short getparm
 35018                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 35019                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 35020                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35021                                  swterr:
 35022                                  	retn
 35023                                  
 35024                                  getparm:
 35025                                  	call	check_switch
 35026                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 35027                                  	jc	short swterr
 35028                                  getnext:
 35029                                  	call	getchr
 35030                                  	;jc	short done_line
 35031                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 35032                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35033                                  	jnc	short nextswtch
 35034                                  ;swterr:
 35035                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 35036                                  
 35037                                  done_line:
 35038                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35039                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 35040                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 35041                                  	jnz	short okay
 35042                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 35043                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 35044                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35045                                  	retn
 35046                                  
 35047                                  okay:
 35048                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 35049                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 35050                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 35051                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 35052                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 35053                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35054                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35055                                  	; cf=0
 35056                                  	;clc
 35057                                  	;call	setdeviceparameters
 35058                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35059                                  	jmp	setdeviceparameters
 35060                                  ;exitpl:
 35061                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35062                                  	; ds = cs
 35063                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 35064                                  	retn
 35065                                  put_back:
 35066                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 35067                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 35068                                  	jmp	short done_line
 35069                                  
 35070                                  %endif

 35074                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 35075                                  ;
 35076                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 35077                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 35078                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 35079                                  ; error.
 35080                                  ;
 35081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35082                                  
 35083                                  ; 09/09/2023
 35084                                  
 35085                                  err_swtch:
 35086 00003501 31CB                    	xor	bx,cx			; remove this switch from the records
 35087                                  err_check:
 35088 00003503 F9                      	stc
 35089                                  err_chk:
 35090                                  done_swtch:	; 09/09/2023 (cf=0)
 35091 00003504 C3                      	retn

 35097                                  	;jc	short err_check

 35100 0000350C 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'

 35119

 35173                                  ;
 35174                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 35175                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero

 35177                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.

 35207                                  	;jmp	short done_ret

 35211                                  try_t:

 35348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35349                                  ;
 35350                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 35351                                  ;
 35352                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 35353                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 35354                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 35355                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 35356                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 35357                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 35358                                  ;
 35359                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 35360                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 35361                                  ;
 35362                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 35363                                  ;
 35364                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35365                                  
 35366                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35367                                  
 35368                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 35369                                  
 35370                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35371                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)
 35372                                  
 35373                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 35374                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:4236h)
 35375                                  
 35376                                  setdeviceparameters:
 35377                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35378                                  	; ds = cs
 35379

 35381

 35383 000035C6 07                      	pop	es
 35384                                  
 35385 000035C7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 35386 000035C9 8A1E[3448]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 35387 000035CD 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 35388 000035D0 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 35389                                  
 35390 000035D2 C706[3748]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 35391                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 35392                                  got_80:

 35394 000035DA 8BB7[DC49]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb

 35427                                  
 35428                                  heads_not_altered:
 35429                                  
 35430                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 35431                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 35432

 35434                                  	; 02/11/2022
 35435                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 35436                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35437 00003602 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 35438 00003605 A2[3C48]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 35439                                  
 35440 00003608 B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 35441                                  
 35442                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 35443                                  
 35444                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 35445                                  	; 02/11/2022
 35446 0000360A 8A3E[4448]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 35447                                  	
 35448                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35449                                  	; ax = 2
 35450 0000360E 3906[4948]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 35451                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 35452 00003612 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediaid ; just use default if heads>2
 35453                                  
 35454 00003614 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 35455                                  
 35456                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 35457                                  
 35458 00003616 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 35459                                  
 35460                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 35461                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 35462                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 35463                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 35464                                  
 35465                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 35466                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 35467                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 35468                                  
 35469 00003618 833E[4748]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 35470 0000361D 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 35471 0000361F 833E[3748]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 35472 00003624 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 35473                                  
 35474                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 35475                                  
 35476 00003626 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 35477                                  
 35478                                  ;	check for 320K
 35479                                  
 35480                                  not_144m:
 35481 00003628 833E[3748]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 35482 0000362D 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediaid
 35483 0000362F 833E[4748]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 35484 00003634 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediaid
 35485                                  
 35486 00003636 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 35487 00003638 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediaid
 35488                                  
 35489                                  only_one_head:
 35490                                  
 35491                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 35492                                  
 35493 0000363A 803E[3448]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 35494 0000363F 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 35495                                  
 35496                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 35497                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 35498                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 35499                                  
 35500 00003641 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 35501 00003643 833E[4748]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 35502                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35503 00003648 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 35504                                  
 35505 0000364A B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 35506                                  
 35507                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 35508                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 35509                                  
 35510                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 35511                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35512                                  	; ax = 2
 35513 0000364C 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 35514 0000364D A2[3C48]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 35515                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 35516                                  
 35517                                  got_correct_mediaid:
 35518 00003650 881E[4448]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 35519                                  
 35520                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 35521                                  
 35522 00003654 A1[3748]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 35523 00003657 F726[4948]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 35524 0000365B F726[4748]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 35525 0000365F A3[4248]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 35526 00003662 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 35527                                  
 35528 00003663 C3                      	retn
 35529

 36074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36075                                  ;
 36076                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 36077                                  ;
 36078                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 36079                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 36080                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 36081                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 36082                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 36083                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 36084                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 36085                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 36086                                  ;
 36087                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36088                                  
 36089                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36090                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 36091                                  
 36092                                  skip_comment:

 36094                                  
 36095                                  	; 03/01/2023
 36096                                  	; ds = cs	
 36097                                  
 36098 0000386E 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 36099                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.

 36101                                  
 36102 00003875 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 36103                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 36104 0000387A 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 36105                                  
 36106 0000387C 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 36107                                  	
 36108 0000387F 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 36109                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 36110 00003883 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 36111                                  
 36112 00003885 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 36113                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 36114 0000388A 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 36115                                  
 36116 0000388C 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 36117                                  	
 36118 00003890 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 36119                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 36120 00003894 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 36121                                  skip_cmmt:
 36122 00003896 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 36123 00003898 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]

 36138                                  
 36139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36140                                  ;
 36141                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 36142                                  ;
 36143                                  ;   INPUT
 36144                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36145                                  ;
 36146                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36147                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 36148                                  ;
 36149                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36150                                  ;       All
 36151                                  ;
 36152                                  ;   HISTORY
 36153                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36154                                  ;
 36155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36156                                  
 36157                                  kbd_read:
 36158 000038A2 F606[FF46]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 36159 000038A7 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 36160                                  
 36161 000038A9 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 36162 000038AA 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 36163 000038AC 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 36164                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 36165                                  kbd_loop:
 36166 000038AE B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 36167 000038B0 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 36168 000038B2 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 36169 000038B4 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36170 000038B6 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36171 000038B8 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36172 000038BA 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 36173 000038BC A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 36174                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 36175                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36176 000038BF 2E2B06[8603]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 36177                                  
 36178 000038C4 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 36179 000038C6 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 36180                                  kbd_loopdone:
 36181 000038C8 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 36182                                  kbd_nodelay:
 36183 000038C9 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 36184 000038CB B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36185 000038CD CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36186 000038CF A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36187 000038D1 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 36188 000038D3 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 36189 000038D4 43                              inc     bx
 36190                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 36191 000038D5 800E[0347]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 36192                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 36193 000038DA B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 36194 000038DC CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36195 000038DE 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 36196 000038E0 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 36197 000038E2 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 36198                                  
 36199                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 36200 000038E4 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 36201 000038E7 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 36202                                  	
 36203 000038E9 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 36204 000038EC 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 36205                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 36206 000038EE BA[974B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 36207 000038F1 E8DD0B                          call    print
 36208                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 36209 000038F4 800E[0347]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 36210 000038F9 EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 36211                                  kbd_notf5:
 36212                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 36213 000038FB 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 36214 000038FE 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 36215                                  
 36216 00003900 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?

 36218                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 36219 00003905 BA[D54B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 36220 00003908 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 36221 0000390B B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 36222 0000390D 881E[0347]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 36223                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 36224 00003911 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 36225 00003913 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 36226 00003915 C606[0947]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 36227 0000391A 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 36228 0000391C 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 36229                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 36230 0000391E 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 36231 00003921 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 36232                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 36233 00003923 E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 36234 00003926 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 36235 00003927 C3                              retn			;
 36236                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 36237 00003928 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 36238 00003929 C3                              retn			;

 36240                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36241                                  ;
 36242                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 36243                                  ;
 36244                                  ;   INPUT
 36245                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 36246                                  ;
 36247                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36248                                  ;       None
 36249                                  ;
 36250                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36251                                  ;       None
 36252                                  ;
 36253                                  ;   HISTORY
 36254                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36255                                  ;
 36256                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36257                                  
 36258                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36259                                  
 36260                                  set_numlock:
 36261                                          ; 04/01/2023
 36262                                  	;push	ax
 36263 0000392A 1E                              push    ds
 36264 0000392B 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 36265 0000392D 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 36266 0000392F 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 36267 00003932 2E3B06[724B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 36268 00003937 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 36269 00003939 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 36270 0000393E EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 36271                                  not_off:
 36272 00003940 2E3B06[704B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 36273 00003945 F9                              stc
 36274 00003946 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 36275 00003948 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 36276                                  set_done:
 36277 0000394D 1F                              pop     ds
 36278                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36279                                  	;pop	ax
 36280 0000394E C3                              retn
 36281                                  
 36282                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36283                                  
 36284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36285                                  ;
 36286                                  ;   menu_check: check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 36287                                  ;
 36288                                  ;   INPUT
 36289                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 36290                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 36291                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36292                                  ;
 36293                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36294                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 36295                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 36296                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 36297                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 36298                                  ;
 36299                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36300                                  ;       All
 36301                                  ;
 36302                                  ;   NOTES
 36303                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 36304                                  ;
 36305                                  ;   HISTORY
 36306                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36307                                  ;
 36308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36309                                  
 36310                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36311                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 36312                                  
 36313                                  menu_check:
 36314                                  
 36315                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 36316                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 36317                                  
 36318 0000394F 51                              push    cx              ;
 36319 00003950 56                              push    si              ;
 36320 00003951 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 36321                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 36322 00003953 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 36323 00003956 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 36324 00003958 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 36325 0000395A 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 36326 0000395C 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 36327 0000395D EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36328                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 36329 0000395F 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 36330 00003961 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 36331 00003963 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 36332 00003965 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 36333 00003967 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 36334 0000396A 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 36335 0000396F EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36336                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 36337 00003971 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 36338 00003973 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 36339                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 36340 00003975 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 36341                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 36342 00003978 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 36343 0000397A 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 36344 0000397C 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 36345 0000397E 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 36346 00003980 E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 36347 00003983 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 36348 00003985 3A06[B91E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 36349 00003989 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 36350 0000398B 800E[FF46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 36351 00003990 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 36352                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 36353 00003992 3A06[C51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 36354 00003996 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 36355 00003998 800E[FF46]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 36356 0000399D EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 36357                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 36358 0000399F E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36359 000039A2 EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 36360                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 36361 000039A4 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36362 000039A5 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36363                                  
 36364                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 36365                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 36366                                  
 36367 000039A6 F606[FF46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36368 000039AB 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 36369                                  ;
 36370                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 36371                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 36372                                  ;
 36373 000039AD E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 36374 000039B0 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 36375 000039B2 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 36376                                  
 36377                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 36378                                  
 36379                                  menu_search:
 36380 000039B5 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 36381 000039B7 BF[4447]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 36382 000039BA E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 36383 000039BD 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 36384 000039BF C606[3C47]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 36385 000039C4 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 36386                                  
 36387                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 36388                                  
 36389                                  menu_color:
 36390 000039C7 51                      	push	cx              ;
 36391 000039C8 52                      	push	dx              ;
 36392                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 36393                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36394                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 36395 000039C9 E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 36396 000039CC 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 36397 000039CF 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 36398                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 36399                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 36400                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 36401                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 36402 000039D1 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 36403 000039D3 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 36404 000039D6 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 36405 000039D8 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 36406 000039DB 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 36407 000039DE 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 36408                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36409                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 36410 000039E0 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 36411 000039E2 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 36412 000039E4 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 36413                                  check_color:
 36414 000039E6 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 36415 000039E8 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 36416 000039EA 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 36417                                  set_color:
 36418 000039ED 8816[FA46]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 36419 000039F1 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 36420 000039F2 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 36421 000039F3 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 36422                                  
 36423                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 36424                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 36425                                  
 36426                                  menu_found:
 36427 000039F6 C606[0447]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 36428                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 36429 000039FB C606[0847]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 36430 00003A00 8026[0347]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 36431                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36432 00003A05 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 36433 00003A07 8916[0647]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 36434                                  
 36435 00003A0B E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 36436                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36437                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 36438                                  
 36439                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 36440                                  
 36441                                  menu_process:
 36442 00003A0E E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 36443 00003A11 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 36444 00003A13 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36445 00003A15 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 36446 00003A17 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 36447 00003A19 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 36448 00003A1B 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 36449 00003A1D 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 36450 00003A1F 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 36451 00003A21 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 36452 00003A23 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 36453 00003A25 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 36454 00003A27 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 36455 00003A29 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 36456 00003A2B 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 36457 00003A2D 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 36458 00003A2F 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 36459 00003A31 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 36460 00003A34 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 36461 00003A36 F9                              stc                     ;
 36462 00003A37 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 36463 00003A3A EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36464                                  menu_numlock:
 36465 00003A3C E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 36466 00003A3F EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36467                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 36468 00003A41 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 36469                                  
 36470                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 36471                                  
 36472                                  menu_default:
 36473 00003A43 8936[0647]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 36474 00003A47 803E[0947]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 36475 00003A4C 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 36476 00003A4E E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 36477 00003A51 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 36478 00003A53 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 36479 00003A56 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 36480 00003A58 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 36481 00003A5A E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 36482 00003A5D 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 36483                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 36484 00003A60 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 36485 00003A62 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 36486                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 36487 00003A64 881E[0847]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 36488                                  timeout_skip:
 36489 00003A68 EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36490                                  
 36491                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 36492                                  
 36493                                  menu_item:
 36494                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 36495 00003A6A 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 36496 00003A6D 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 36497 00003A6F 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 36498 00003A71 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 36499 00003A74 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 36500 00003A76 F9                              stc                     ;
 36501 00003A77 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 36502 00003A7A EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 36503                                  
 36504                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 36505                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 36506                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 36507                                  
 36508                                  menu_itemfound:
 36509 00003A7C 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 36510 00003A7D 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 36511 00003A7F 8887[0A47]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 36512 00003A83 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 36513                                  
 36514                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 36515                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 36516                                  ;   description...
 36517                                  
 36518 00003A85 89B7[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 36519 00003A89 89B7[2847]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 36520 00003A8D 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 36521 00003A8F E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 36522 00003A92 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 36523 00003A94 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 36524 00003A97 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 36525 00003A99 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 36526 00003A9B 89BF[2847]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 36527                                  
 36528                                  menu_nextitem:
 36529 00003A9F E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36530 00003AA2 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 36531                                  
 36532                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 36533                                  
 36534                                  menu_getdefault:
 36535 00003AA5 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 36536 00003AA7 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 36537 00003AA9 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 36538 00003AAB E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 36539                                  menu_valid:
 36540 00003AAE 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 36541 00003AB0 8816[0547]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 36542 00003AB4 8B3E[0647]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 36543 00003AB8 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 36544 00003ABA 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 36545 00003ABC 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 36546                                  menu_chkdefault:
 36547 00003ABD 53                              push    bx              ;
 36548 00003ABE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36549 00003AC0 8BB7[1447]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36550 00003AC4 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 36551 00003AC7 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36552 00003AC8 06                              push    es              ;
 36553 00003AC9 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36554 00003ACA E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 36555 00003ACD 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36556 00003ACE 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 36557 00003ACF 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 36558 00003AD1 43                              inc     bx              ;
 36559 00003AD2 3A1E[0547]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 36560 00003AD6 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 36561                                  menu_nodefault:
 36562 00003AD8 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 36563                                  menu_setdefault:
 36564 00003ADA 881E[0447]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 36565                                  
 36566                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 36567                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 36568                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 36569                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 36570                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 36571                                  ;   with no timeout)
 36572                                  
 36573 00003ADE 803E[0847]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 36574 00003AE3 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 36575 00003AE5 F606[0347]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 36576 00003AEA 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 36577 00003AEC E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 36578                                  
 36579                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 36580                                  
 36581                                  menu_display:
 36582 00003AEF B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 36583 00003AF1 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36584 00003AF3 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 36585 00003AF5 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36586 00003AF7 06                              push    es              ;
 36587 00003AF8 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 36588 00003AFB 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 36589 00003AFD 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 36590 00003B01 A3[0147]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 36591 00003B04 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 36592 00003B08 A2[0047]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 36593 00003B0B A1[FB46]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 36594 00003B0E CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36595 00003B10 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 36596 00003B13 8A3E[FA46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 36597 00003B17 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 36598                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 36599 00003B19 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 36600 00003B1E FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 36601                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 36602 00003B20 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 36603 00003B25 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 36604 00003B27 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 36605 00003B29 8A36[FE46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 36606                                  menu_clear:
 36607 00003B2D CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 36608 00003B2F 07                              pop     es              ;
 36609 00003B30 8836[FE46]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 36610 00003B34 BA[124C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 36611 00003B37 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 36612                                  
 36613 00003B3A F606[FF46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36614 00003B3F 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 36615 00003B41 8A3E[FB46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 36616 00003B45 8A36[FE46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 36617 00003B49 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 36618 00003B4B B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 36619 00003B4D CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36620 00003B4F BA[604C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 36621 00003B52 E87C09                          call    print           ;
 36622 00003B55 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 36623 00003B57 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36624 00003B59 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 36625 00003B5C 8816[FD46]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 36626                                  
 36627                                  menu_nostatus:
 36628 00003B60 BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 36629                                  menu_disploop:
 36630 00003B63 E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
